tourism.name: Pyramids of Giza
tourism.description: A complex of ancient monuments located in the Giza necropolis, which includes the Great Pyramid of Giza, the Pyramid of Khafre, and the Pyramid of Menkaure. It is one of the most iconic landmarks of Egypt and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

tourism.name: The Nile River
tourism.description: The longest river in the world, which runs through Egypt and is an essential part of its history and culture. Visitors can take a Nile cruise or a felucca ride to explore the river and visit the temples and tombs located along its banks.

tourism.name: Luxor Temple
tourism.description: An ancient temple complex located in the city of Luxor, which dates back to the 14th century BC. It is a great example of Egyptian architecture and is considered one of the best-preserved temples in the country.

tourism.name: Karnak Temple
tourism.description: A vast temple complex located in the city of Luxor, which is dedicated to the god Amun. It is one of the largest religious sites in the world and a popular tourist attraction.

tourism.name: Abu Simbel
tourism.description: An ancient temple complex located in southern Egypt, which was built during the reign of Pharaoh Ramesses II in the 13th century BC. It is known for its impressive rock-cut temples and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

tourism.name: Masai Mara National Reserve
tourism.description: One of the most popular tourist destinations in Kenya, Masai Mara National Reserve is known for its wildlife, including the 'Big Five' game animals (lion, leopard, rhinoceros, elephant, and Cape buffalo). Visitors can take guided safaris, balloon rides, and witness the great wildebeest migration.

tourism.name: Mount Kenya
tourism.description: Mount Kenya is the highest mountain in Kenya and the second-highest in Africa. It offers hiking and climbing opportunities, with various trails ranging in difficulty. The mountain also supports a rich diversity of flora and fauna.

tourism.name: Mombasa
tourism.description: Mombasa is a coastal city with a rich history and culture. Visitors can explore the old town, visit Fort Jesus (a UNESCO World Heritage Site), relax on the beaches, and go snorkeling or diving in the nearby marine parks.
